description: A 1-minute de-risking session on False Balance: When 'Both Sides' Misleads.

hook.text: 97% of scientists agree on climate change. A news segment gives equal time to a denier. Fair? Or dangerously misleading?

buildup.text: False balance occurs when media gives equal weight to positions with vastly unequal evidence, creating a false.

discovery.text: Journalists trained in 'objectivity' sometimes confuse balance with accuracy.

twist.text: Studies show false balance on climate change confused the public for decades ‚Äî people believed scientific disagreement.

climax.text: True journalistic balance isn't giving equal time. It's giving proportional weight to evidence.

punchline.text: Fairness isn't giving every opinion equal weight.

quiz.question: What is false balance in media?
options: Giving equal weight to positions with vastly unequal evidence
